instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
threads.message:
u7100 circuit was damaged, i replaced most of the stuff.
i also have u7201, U7750 replaced as there are was corrosion.

green light, orange light can charge etc. when i turn on, the fan spin for like 10sec then stop then spin again (regular fan speed)

USB mouse's light is red.

PPBUS_G3H = 12.5v
PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS = 12.5v
PPDCIN_G3H = 16.6
PP3V42_G3H = 3.4v
PPVCORE_S0_MCP_REG = 1.06v
PPVCORE_S0_CPU = 0.988v
PP1V8_S0 = 1.8v
MCPCORES0_EN = 3.29v

C7771 - 1.1v.

original 85w charger.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
threads.message: does it beep when you remove ram?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
[SOLVED]820-2330 - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
threads.message: nvm..i've fixed. realised some resistors fall out from other side of the board while repairing, probably due to heat and movement.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820-2330 - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
[SOLVED]820-2330 - no chime, liquid damaged. green light.
threads.message: R5142 was hanging on its last leg and R5158 was missing.
